storyInfo: In times past, Quartz spent a brief while with a family. However, an ill turn rears its head all too soon, sending massive shockwaves through this small and tender moment.

attributes.content: Ivy, stick close behind me. Don't let the crowd sweep you away.
attributes.name: Quartz

attributes.content: Just hold out a minute more. I'll treat your wounds the moment we're somewhere safe.
attributes.name: Quartz

attributes.content: Ugh... piece of shit mayor. Lost his goddamn mind.
attributes.name: Ivy

attributes.content: He saw how many there were in that store, and set fire to it anyway. He doesn't even give a shit who lives or dies.
attributes.name: Ivy

attributes.content: I can tell why you've always made him out to be such a bastard.
attributes.name: Quartz

attributes.content: Yeah, it's a whole house of bastards. Him and his mercenary goons.
attributes.name: Ivy

attributes.content: We all usually try to stay away from them, but somehow they still come calling.
attributes.name: Ivy

attributes.content: This way. Less people around.
attributes.name: Quartz

attributes.content: Hey, hey. Girlie. Hold it there. What's the rush?
attributes.name: Old Panhandler

attributes.content: Where's my allowance today? Huh? Got it on you?
attributes.name: Old Panhandler

attributes.content: Eesh, seriously, friend... you pick some amazing times to ask me for money.
attributes.name: Ivy

attributes.content: The mayor's guys are coming this way. You sure you wanna be sitting there?
attributes.name: Ivy

attributes.content: When you ain't got nothing, you ain't got nothing to lose.
attributes.name: Old Panhandler

attributes.content: And that goes for the two of you, too. Whatcha so afraid of, scramming like hell?
attributes.name: Old Panhandler

attributes.content: You guys didn't start jack shit. So what's gotcha running out so far? Huh?
attributes.name: Old Panhandler

attributes.content: Let's move, Ivy.
attributes.name: Quartz

attributes.content: *huff*—Finally home.
attributes.name: Ivy

attributes.content: Ivy, let me take a look at your wounds.
attributes.name: Quartz

attributes.content: (Not deep, luckily. Quick ad-hoc treatment first, stop the bleeding.)
attributes.name: Quartz

attributes.content: Anywhere else you're hurt, apart from the leg?
attributes.name: Quartz

attributes.content: Mnn... I'm fine. Just catching my breath.
attributes.name: Ivy

attributes.content: Freaking bastard... how can he exist?
attributes.name: Ivy

attributes.content: I seriously hope someone teaches him a goddamn hard-ass lesson one day.
attributes.name: Ivy

attributes.content: Hey, Dad! We're back!
attributes.name: Ivy

attributes.content: I heard about the commotion. And then you two went missing at the exact same time... Had me stressed to high heaven.
attributes.name: Uncle Pickett

attributes.content: And how'd you get hurt, what happened? The heck did you two get up to?
attributes.name: Uncle Pickett

attributes.content: Mayor caught someone smuggling goods behind his back. Didn't just beat the tar out of them, set fire to their store too.
attributes.name: Quartz

attributes.content: We were in there at the time, then Ivy hurt herself on accident as we ran out.
attributes.name: Quartz

attributes.content: That mayor...
attributes.name: Uncle Pickett

attributes.content: I warned you two not to head outdoors these days, didn't I? You gotta stay put at home.
attributes.name: Uncle Pickett

attributes.content: I just... wanted to buy Quartz a present.
attributes.name: Ivy

attributes.content: You know she's leaving soon.
attributes.name: Ivy

attributes.content: No talking back, just answer me—did I, or did I not tell you to stay put at home?
attributes.name: Uncle Pickett

attributes.content: Mrgh... yes, Dad, you did.
attributes.name: Ivy

attributes.content: So, tell me, was what you just did wrong of you?
attributes.name: Uncle Pickett

attributes.content: ...Yes, it was.
attributes.name: Ivy

attributes.content: Enough! Ivy's hurt and all you want to do is chastise her!
attributes.name: Aunt Pickett

attributes.content: Come here, sweetie, and let me take a look at that injury.
attributes.name: Aunt Pickett

attributes.content: Mom!
attributes.name: Ivy

attributes.content: I'm okay, see! Besides, Quartz has been looking out for me the whole time.
attributes.name: Ivy

attributes.content: Is that right? Be sure you thank her properly, then. But don't forget to listen to your pa, too.
attributes.name: Aunt Pickett

attributes.content: Mm...
attributes.name: Ivy

attributes.content: Thank you, Quartz.
attributes.name: Ivy

attributes.content: I should be apologizing, really. It's my fault you went out in the first place.
attributes.name: Quartz

attributes.content: I'm sorry, Uncle Pickett, for the trouble I've made.
attributes.name: Quartz

attributes.content: *sigh*... Forget it. We're lucky you were by her side. Who knows what could've happened to her otherwise.
attributes.name: Uncle Pickett

attributes.content: You know, you are leaving tomorrow, Quartz.
attributes.name: Aunt Pickett

attributes.content: What's your favorite food? I'll make it for you tonight.
attributes.name: Aunt Pickett

attributes.content: Quartz... can't you just stay? I don't want you to go...
attributes.name: Ivy

attributes.content: Dad, couldn't we let Quartz stay at our place?
attributes.name: Ivy

attributes.content: I know it's tomorrow, but just for even a day longer, please...?
attributes.name: Ivy

attributes.text: If my father never left... if my mother never fell ill...
We would've been living our lives out together like this, as a family.
But I never got to make those memories, nor will I ever have the chance to make up for that.

attributes.content: It's not like you'll never see me again, Ives. I'll come visit.
attributes.name: Quartz

attributes.content: Uncle Pickett, thank you for your hospitality these past few days.
attributes.name: Quartz

attributes.content: I really should get going sooner than later, after bothering you for this long.
attributes.name: Quartz

attributes.content: Hrmph. Don't thank me.
attributes.name: Uncle Pickett

attributes.content: Fact of the matter is, I'm eager to get you out. Ivy's been sticking to you like glue, and I'm scared to find out what she's been learning.
attributes.name: Uncle Pickett

attributes.content: I'm amazed your parents would approve of you heading out alone into wilds as dangerous as ours.
attributes.name: Uncle Pickett

attributes.content: They, uh...
attributes.name: Quartz

attributes.content: I imagine they would want to leave home and see the sights too, but... they've never had the chance.
attributes.name: Quartz

attributes.content: I know my father wouldn't approve. You're just like him, you know, always going on about how dangerous it is out there. Though I suppose he wasn't wrong.
attributes.name: Quartz

attributes.content: And you still went, knowing full well?
attributes.name: Uncle Pickett

attributes.content: Let me tell you, the people here—one second they're with those Liberi evangelists, wailing and gnashing and flogging themselves for all their past sins.
attributes.name: Uncle Pickett

attributes.content: But look away for one moment, and they'll cut your throat for a glass of beer, over a bet, for a single pet cystybeast.
attributes.name: Uncle Pickett

attributes.content: And lately, bandits have been raiding supply cars and Pioneer Teams right outside of town.
attributes.name: Uncle Pickett

attributes.content: Our own mayor's a monster, and it's not like old Vincent at the precinct'll do anything for you.
attributes.name: Uncle Pickett

attributes.content: Anything could happen here, and at any time. And when it does, there won't be a soul to help you, you understand?
attributes.name: Uncle Pickett

attributes.content: So if you're done with your business, I say you hurry back on home.
attributes.name: Uncle Pickett

attributes.text: I remember how I used to listen to my father jabber on like this, time after time.
It's an... indescribably familiar tone.

attributes.content: Mm...
attributes.name: Quartz

attributes.content: Enough. Couldn't tell you what time it is right now, but I know it's late.
attributes.name: Uncle Pickett

attributes.content: It's nine. The store across the street closes every night around then, and I just heard them moving stuff out of there.
attributes.name: Quartz

attributes.content: Huh? Oh...
attributes.name: Uncle Pickett

attributes.content: Then get your belongings sorted pronto, and rest up. Meanwhile, I've got deliveries to run for that bastard... my rotten luck.
attributes.name: Uncle Pickett

attributes.content: Stay safe tomorrow. Be home soon as you can.
attributes.name: Uncle Pickett

attributes.content: Nine...
attributes.name: Quartz

attributes.content: I guess I should be turning in about now. I always have.
attributes.name: Quartz

attributes.content: I don't want to sleep.
attributes.name: Quartz

attributes.content: But I don't know what else I feel like doing.
attributes.name: Quartz

attributes.text: I don't know why, but everything that happened today is swirling through my brain like a tornado now.
Maybe I should do something or other.
*thud* *thud* *thud*!

attributes.content: (That's the sound of my father fixing the roof.)
attributes.name: Quartz

attributes.content: That ought to do it. And that means your mom can get a good night's sleep.
attributes.name: Father

attributes.content: Quartz! Quit it!
attributes.name: Father

attributes.content: Pay attention. Watch very carefully how I do things.
attributes.name: Father

attributes.content: You're going to have to do this stuff yourself someday, you know.
attributes.name: Father

attributes.text: *thud* *thud* *thud*!

attributes.content: (That's the sound of thugs knocking at the door for repayment.)
attributes.name: Quartz

attributes.content: Get the hell out! Who let you into OUR house?!
attributes.name: Father

attributes.content: You know I'm going to pay back what I owe! But if you people DARE show up at our door like this again, I will NOT hesitate!
attributes.name: Father

attributes.content: See that, Quartz?
attributes.name: Father

attributes.content: It'll be your turn to protect your mom soon. So never, ever fear anybody.
attributes.name: Father

attributes.content: I won't be here to shield you guys forever, and like hell anyone else will help you. You gotta handle all this on your own.
attributes.name: Father

attributes.text: *thud*! *thud*! *thud*!

attributes.content: Shit! It's already so bright outside the window.
attributes.name: Quartz

attributes.content: How did I wake up so late today? I shouldn't have, I shouldn't...
attributes.name: Quartz

attributes.content: I still have to... to...
attributes.name: Quartz

attributes.text: *thud* *thud* *thud*!

attributes.content: (No, wait, that's the sound of someone knocking at the door.)
attributes.name: Quartz

attributes.content: Who is it?!
attributes.name: Quartz

attributes.content: Quartz! Wake up! For the love of god, get up!
attributes.name: Father?

attributes.content: Take your belongings and run!
attributes.name: Father?

attributes.content: Ivy, you and your mom stay in there for now and don't come out.
attributes.name: Uncle Pickett

attributes.content: The hell are you doing, crashing my house like this?!
attributes.name: Uncle Pickett

attributes.content: (Mayor got jumped by someone last night. Steamed him so bad he sent out a search, leave no stone unturned and all. Won't calm down until we find the perp.)
attributes.name: Old Officer Vincent

attributes.content: (And you guys are the only ones who saw him last night.)
attributes.name: Old Officer Vincent

attributes.content: (Just work with me, okay? My hands are tied here...)
attributes.name: Old Officer Vincent

attributes.content: (He got attacked? Who has the balls to...)
attributes.name: Uncle Pickett

attributes.content: When I knock, I want you to open! The hell are you yapping for?!
attributes.name: Mercenary A

attributes.content: Shit-for-brains, all of you!
attributes.name: Mercenary A

attributes.content: Gargh!
attributes.name: Uncle Pickett

attributes.content: Dad! Are you okay?!
attributes.name: Ivy

attributes.content: Get back in there.
attributes.name: Uncle Pickett

attributes.content: No! Why should I—
attributes.name: Ivy

attributes.content: Get back!
attributes.name: Uncle Pickett

attributes.content: Yeah, that's right, keep your girl in check. Don't make this any more complicated than it needs to be.
attributes.name: Mercenary A

attributes.content: Nothing to hide, nothing to fear, okay, buddy?!
attributes.name: Mercenary A

attributes.content: Shit pisses me off, honestly. I'd rather kill the goddamn lot of you and THEN figure out if you did it.
attributes.name: Mercenary A

attributes.content: Ivy, listen to me. Go to your friend Quartz and stick with her.
attributes.name: Aunt Pickett

attributes.content: It'll all be fine. Don't worry.
attributes.name: Aunt Pickett

attributes.text: I saw Ivy's face in that instant...
I was once like her. Unwilling, furious, but forced to swallow my anger.
Feeling pale and lost and praying for a miracle, or for some kind of hero. A million parts of you screaming, every last uncountable cell in you, but never getting an answer.

attributes.content: I came back right after I was done with the mayor's deliveries. Didn't take a step outside after that.
attributes.name: Uncle Pickett

attributes.content: All the neighbors around can testify. We were all here at home.
attributes.name: Uncle Pickett

attributes.content: And it's just me, my wife, and these two girls here. How could we...
attributes.name: Uncle Pickett

attributes.content: Hey! Check this out!
attributes.name: Mercenary B

attributes.content: Guess what I found in the other room here?! This thing weighs a ton!
attributes.name: Mercenary B

attributes.content: Drop the weapon! Now!
attributes.name: Mercenary B

attributes.content: The hell are you?!
attributes.name: Mercenary A

attributes.content: Easy there! Final warning!
attributes.name: Mercenary B

attributes.content: Is that... yours, Quartz?
attributes.name: Ivy

attributes.content: You...
attributes.name: Ivy

attributes.text: Ivy's eyes swim like hope when all is lost.
Maybe I've gotten rusty after not using a greatsword for so long, because it feels a little stiff in my hands.
But it's at home all the same.
I ready myself to face the enemy.
Yet out of the corner of my eye, I see someone pull Ivy from my side.

attributes.content: (Dad?!)
attributes.name: Ivy

attributes.content: (Quit pulling me! Quartz was...)
attributes.name: Ivy

attributes.content: (If you want our family to stay out of trouble, then starting now, you shut your damn mouth.)
attributes.name: Uncle Pickett

attributes.content: (I tell you this with every inch of solemnity: do not go near her.)
attributes.name: Uncle Pickett

attributes.content: (Ugh! Dad!)
attributes.name: Ivy

attributes.content: Vincent, she was lodging at our place, nothing more.
attributes.name: Uncle Pickett

attributes.content: You wouldn't forget, would you? It was you who brought her to seek our help in the first place.
attributes.name: Uncle Pickett

attributes.content: Uh... uh, yeah!
attributes.name: Old Officer Vincent

attributes.content: I was just thinking how pitiful she seemed at the time...
attributes.name: Old Officer Vincent

attributes.content: We only agreed on account of her seeming like just your regular lady. We didn't think anything more of it.
attributes.name: Uncle Pickett

attributes.content: So whoever she really is, we don't know a damn, and we sure as hell never asked.
attributes.name: Uncle Pickett

attributes.content: (Sorry, kid.)
attributes.name: Uncle Pickett

attributes.text: Here I thought I'd find a part of my life I'd never had before.
Here I thought I could make up for my past regrets.
But that was just wishful thinking. It was all an illusion.

attributes.content: They have nothing to do with this.
attributes.name: Quartz

attributes.content: I don't know them.
attributes.name: Quartz

attributes.text: *thud*! *thud*! *thud*!

attributes.content: (That's the sound of my heart pounding.)
attributes.name: Quartz

attributes.content: See that? That's what happens when you rock the boat.
attributes.name: Foreman

attributes.content: If you have half a mind to keep working here, to keep making money...
attributes.name: Foreman

attributes.content: ...then don't ask unless you're told to ask, and don't mind unless you're told to mind.
attributes.name: Foreman

attributes.content: Understand?
attributes.name: Foreman

attributes.text: *thud*... *thud*... *thud*...

attributes.content: (That's the sound of my mother's fading pulse.)
attributes.name: Quartz

attributes.content: Happy birthday, Mom!
attributes.name: Quartz

attributes.content: Look!
attributes.name: Quartz

attributes.content: It's that present Dad promised he'd get you. I finally bought it!
attributes.name: Quartz

attributes.content: Mom...
attributes.name: Quartz

attributes.content: Son of a bitch!
attributes.name: Mercenary A

attributes.content: Now, now... that's enough.
attributes.name: Old Officer Vincent

attributes.content: Look, she ain't moving anymore... Heaven knows if you just killed her...
attributes.name: Old Officer Vincent

attributes.content: Tch... none of your goddamn business. Let's go to the mayor.
attributes.name: Mercenary A

attributes.content: Watch her, old man. You know what happens if you let her run.
attributes.name: Mercenary B

attributes.content: Yeah...
attributes.name: Old Officer Vincent

attributes.content: Miss? Miss?
attributes.name: Old Officer Vincent

attributes.content: Ugh...
attributes.name: Quartz

attributes.content: Phew... Had me sweating there. Thought you'd done kicked the bucket for real.
attributes.name: Old Officer Vincent

attributes.content: You're... Quartz, right? My memory ain't what it used to be.
attributes.name: Old Officer Vincent

attributes.content: Yeah, it's Quartz.
attributes.name: Quartz

attributes.content: I'll confess, I can get why you'd carry a weapon everywhere, seeing how dangerous it is out there alone.
attributes.name: Old Officer Vincent

attributes.content: But you sure walked into one hell of a mess...
attributes.name: Old Officer Vincent

attributes.content: *sigh* If you ask me, I know you didn't do it. If you're looking for someone who'd lay hands on that...
attributes.name: Old Officer Vincent

attributes.content: (...that bastard, there's plenty townsfolk who'd jump in line before an outsider like you ever got the chance.)
attributes.name: Old Officer Vincent

attributes.content: No matter what happens, no matter the consequences...
attributes.name: Quartz

attributes.content: I can take it.
attributes.name: Quartz

attributes.content: Not like I know where I should be going, anyway.
attributes.name: Quartz

attributes.content: Anything? No matter the consequences? Easy for you to say, but what about your family, huh? Your parents? You think they could take it?
attributes.name: Old Officer Vincent

attributes.content: Look, I don't know where you're from, but worst case...
attributes.name: Old Officer Vincent

attributes.content: Just supposing there's, uh... a word or two I'd want to deliver your folks, I'd at least like to know who I'm looking for...
attributes.name: Old Officer Vincent

attributes.content: I'll be going to find them myself, soon enough.
attributes.name: Quartz

attributes.content: What, you're gonna run after all? You can't cut me a break, can you?
attributes.name: Old Officer Vincent

attributes.content: You know how many people are out there? I don't think you can run.
attributes.name: Old Officer Vincent

attributes.content: *sigh*... Off the record, but... if you did manage to make off... I don't know whether I'd cry from fear or joy.
attributes.name: Old Officer Vincent

attributes.content: I mean, thinking about it... I know everyone's tearing into my ass these days.
attributes.name: Old Officer Vincent

attributes.content: But I've got a family too... and god help me, I know you didn't do it... but I'm just scared to contemplate... I'm sorry...
attributes.name: Old Officer Vincent

attributes.content: I bet Pickett's of the same mind... much as it's not my place to talk.
attributes.name: Old Officer Vincent

attributes.content: I'm sorry...
attributes.name: Old Officer Vincent

attributes.content: Really am.
attributes.name: Old Officer Vincent

attributes.content: You done sermonizing there? 'Cause I'm sick of listening.
attributes.name: Old Panhandler

attributes.content: One man spends all that breath t'say he knows the girl didn't do shit, and oh how he sympathizes, yet won't stick his neck out one inch.
attributes.name: Old Panhandler

attributes.content: Holy—?! How'd you get in?!
attributes.name: Old Officer Vincent

attributes.content: What's your business here?!
attributes.name: Old Officer Vincent

attributes.content: My business is with her, and not you.
attributes.name: Old Panhandler

attributes.content: Need you to take a little nap though.
attributes.name: Old Panhandler

attributes.content: Ungh!
attributes.name: Old Officer Vincent

attributes.content: M'pologies, girlie.
attributes.name: Old Panhandler

attributes.content: Didn't know I'd tow you into this, ah, hullabaloo. *sigh*...
attributes.name: Old Panhandler

attributes.content: How'd you get past everyone outside?
attributes.name: Quartz

attributes.content: Outside? Hell, it's pure carnage outside right now, didn'tcha know?
attributes.name: Old Panhandler

attributes.content: Also, just before I let you go... you got any interest in joinin' us?
attributes.name: Old Panhandler

attributes.content: Dad, what the hell is the mayor calling everyone here for?
attributes.name: Ivy

attributes.content: What's he gonna do?!
attributes.name: Ivy

attributes.content: I don't know.
attributes.name: Uncle Pickett

attributes.content: The two of you, stay with me. Don't get lost.
attributes.name: Uncle Pickett

attributes.content: I don't get it. Why is everyone so afraid of him?
attributes.name: Ivy

attributes.content: We've got the numbers, look at us. Can't we just drive him out of town?!
attributes.name: Ivy

attributes.content: Ivy, your dad is going to beg you here.
attributes.name: Uncle Pickett

attributes.content: Yes, in fact, I am BEGGING you!
attributes.name: Uncle Pickett

attributes.content: LISTEN to me, okay? I don't want nothing bad happening to you.
attributes.name: Uncle Pickett

attributes.content: Long as we're together as a family, we'll be fine.
attributes.name: Uncle Pickett

attributes.content: Just... trust your dad, okay?
attributes.name: Uncle Pickett

attributes.content: Just catching the perp won't be enough. If there's even one person willing to try their luck, then I guarantee you there will be a second.
attributes.name: Mayor

attributes.content: Just goes to show I've been too easy on them. They've begun to get wicked thoughts, and I won't let that stand.
attributes.name: Mayor

attributes.content: And so what if we catch them, anyway? This whole chase ain't healing my wounds, or staying my rage.
attributes.name: Mayor

attributes.content: What do you want us to do?
attributes.name: Mercenary A

attributes.content: Round up the families you've investigated, plus the two merchants who thought importing behind my back was a smart idea...
attributes.name: Mayor

attributes.content: Get them all locked up. Whoever doesn't behave, throw them in a Pioneer Team.
attributes.name: Mayor

attributes.content: But keep one from every family in the town. That way, no one will try to take the chance to run.
attributes.name: Mayor

attributes.content: Squeeze them where it hurts, and they'll listen.
attributes.name: Mayor

attributes.content: On it...
attributes.name: Mercenary A

attributes.content: Dad!
attributes.name: Ivy

attributes.content: You sons of bitches! What is this?!
attributes.name: Uncle Pickett

attributes.content: We're not even Infected! The hell are we going to Pioneer Teams for?!
attributes.name: Uncle Pickett

attributes.content: Either you stay in town and your wife and daughter get sent, or your daughter stays and you and your wife are brand new Pioneers.
attributes.name: Mercenary A

attributes.content: Am I clear?!
attributes.name: Mercenary A

attributes.content: Dad...
attributes.name: Ivy

attributes.content: Can I... go to the Pioneers myself?
attributes.name: Uncle Pickett

attributes.content: Let my wife and girl stay, I beg of you.
attributes.name: Uncle Pickett

attributes.content: This ain't open for discussion.
attributes.name: Mercenary A

attributes.content: Only one of you stays in town!
attributes.name: Mercenary A

attributes.content: You—! You assholes! This is too far!
attributes.name: Ivy

attributes.content: They found you while you were casing the place, so you just walloped the mayor right there?
attributes.name: Quartz

attributes.content: You're roving bandits, right? The raids outside of town these days, that's all you. You're eyeing the town itself now?
attributes.name: Quartz

attributes.content: Bandits, fugitives, criminals... call us whatever you like.
attributes.name: Old Panhandler

attributes.content: We're just a buncha regular folk at the end of our ropes.
attributes.name: Old Panhandler

attributes.content: And we're not eyeing the town. We're eyeing the mayor, and every one of his kind.
attributes.name: Old Panhandler

attributes.content: And what about the rest of the townsfolk?
attributes.name: Quartz

attributes.content: Pull something this loud, and you'll drag a whole mess of people in, including the innocent.
attributes.name: Quartz

attributes.content: *sigh*... Listen to you, a bundle of nerves like all the rest.
attributes.name: Old Panhandler

attributes.content: We're just lookin' to hold the guys at the top accountable. Not like we're tryin' to be heroes of justice or whatnot.
attributes.name: Old Panhandler

attributes.content: These people are weak. They're cowardly. They don't give a damn.
attributes.name: Old Panhandler

attributes.content: They get what's comin' to them.
attributes.name: Old Panhandler

attributes.content: Doubtin', worryin', fearin', mindin' what they do so much, they may as well do the safest thing—which is nothin' at all.
attributes.name: Old Panhandler

attributes.content: And that makes the most obedient kinda person, don'tcha see? They got doubts. They never dare. That's why everyone here fears the mayor.
attributes.name: Old Panhandler

attributes.content: But I don't. I'm an old panhandler with no job, no home. What do I fear?
attributes.name: Old Panhandler

attributes.content: He yaps my ear off, no shit I'll beat the daylights outta him.
attributes.name: Old Panhandler

attributes.content: Maybe he woulda killed me, but like hell he could take me, so I beat him to kingdom come. Damn shame he got away.
attributes.name: Old Panhandler

attributes.content: And here he is now, takin' it out on these folks because he couldn't face up to me any day of the week.
attributes.name: Old Panhandler

attributes.content: Makes all kinds of sense, wouldn'tcha say?
attributes.name: Old Panhandler

attributes.content: You can't get a damn thing done for how you stick fast to the rules. And them? They live like there's no law, and their reward is kickin' their feet up on top of your heads.
attributes.name: Old Panhandler

attributes.content: So hell, what's the problem? What's to fear?
attributes.name: Old Panhandler

attributes.content: Sure you'll be 'bad,' but what's that even matter?
attributes.name: Old Panhandler

attributes.content: You really don't talk like a panhandler.
attributes.name: Quartz

attributes.content: But a panhandler I've been made to be, and I'll let you know you've become quite a vagabond yourself.
attributes.name: Old Panhandler

attributes.content: So say I choose not to join you?
attributes.name: Quartz

attributes.content: You can leave anytime, carry on your journey. I won't force you, that much is granted.
attributes.name: Old Panhandler

attributes.content: I'll see you on your way. Get goin'.
attributes.name: Old Panhandler

attributes.content: Ivy! What the hell?!
attributes.name: Uncle Pickett

attributes.content: Drop that goddamn weapon! You're going to hurt yourself!
attributes.name: Uncle Pickett

attributes.content: Miss, you'd best listen to your pap.
attributes.name: Mercenary A

attributes.content: Don't be in a rush to get yourself hurt. Think of your mom and pap—just think of them.
attributes.name: Mercenary A

attributes.content: Good. Think. You try and take us, and what do you think'll happen to them?
attributes.name: Mercenary A

attributes.content: No one here wants to see anything gruesome.
attributes.name: Mercenary B

attributes.content: Ivy, don't do anything stupid!
attributes.name: Uncle Pickett

attributes.content: So long as we're a family, we can get through anything together.
attributes.name: Uncle Pickett

attributes.content: But we're not gonna be, are we? We're not gonna be together.
attributes.name: Ivy

attributes.content: Doesn't matter who goes to the Pioneers and who stays in town, we're getting split up.
attributes.name: Ivy

attributes.content: And who the hell knows what happens after that?
attributes.name: Ivy

attributes.content: I can see where this is going, and it's nowhere good.
attributes.name: Ivy

attributes.content: So, what's the worst that could happen? You guys gonna kill me?
attributes.name: Ivy

attributes.content: Alright! Say I die, Dad, are you gonna take revenge for me? Or are you gonna keep wrangling with yourself?
attributes.name: Ivy

attributes.content: Ivy! What is this nonsense you're cooking?!
attributes.name: Uncle Pickett

attributes.content: Weren't you guys gonna take me?!
attributes.name: Ivy

attributes.content: C'mon, then! C'MON!
attributes.name: Ivy

attributes.content: Shit!
attributes.name: Mercenary A

attributes.content: Your time's up, kid!
attributes.name: Mercenary B

attributes.content: Quartz?!
attributes.name: Ivy

attributes.content: Wha—?!
attributes.name: Ivy

attributes.content: You little shit! How'd you get out?!
attributes.name: Mercenary A

attributes.content: Where the hell is that Vincent SOB?! Did he make his peace or something?!
attributes.name: Mercenary B

attributes.content: Don't bother going. I plan to cut you all down.
attributes.name: Quartz

attributes.content: And then I'll drag that bastard mayor out too!
attributes.name: Quartz

attributes.content: Argh!
attributes.name: Mercenary A & Mercenary B

attributes.content: Whatcha got there?
attributes.name: Old Panhandler

attributes.content: ...That's that girl, ain't it. The one you felt was like a kid sister.
attributes.name: Old Panhandler

attributes.content: Ivy's a brave girl. And Uncle Pickett, and Auntie. None of them are bad people.
attributes.name: Quartz

attributes.content: I want to deny it so badly, but if years and years ago, I were in their place, I might've done the same as them.
attributes.name: Quartz

attributes.content: I hurt my own father out of fear of someone's wrath.
attributes.name: Quartz

attributes.content: Bent over time's knee, strived to work, out of fear I couldn't pay for my mother's treatments.
attributes.name: Quartz

attributes.content: Didn't even know where I went wrong until I lost it all. After doing everything they asked me to do, everything right.
attributes.name: Quartz

attributes.content: I began to regret, to despair, and even to blame those who put doubt in my mind. Felt like if it wasn't for them, I'd have been brave enough to choose differently.
attributes.name: Quartz

attributes.content: And now you have the chance to make up for lost time, with us.
attributes.name: Old Panhandler

attributes.content: The lot you have ain't your fault. Never was.
attributes.name: Old Panhandler

attributes.content: No. It was.
attributes.name: Quartz

attributes.content: Suddenly I understood, when I saw Ivy.
attributes.name: Quartz

attributes.content: I could've chosen completely differently. I've been doing nothing but making excuses. Excuses for my past timidity and weakness.
attributes.name: Quartz

attributes.content: I see how... precious a thing it is, having someone who worries for you.
attributes.name: Quartz

attributes.content: Like Uncle Pickett does for his beloved daughter, and old Vincent does for his little granddaughter.
attributes.name: Quartz

attributes.content: It's a cowardly disgrace, but anything but lamentable.
attributes.name: Quartz

attributes.content: You gonna go help her then? That's a lotta mercs. You ready for that?
attributes.name: Old Panhandler

attributes.content: Did you forget, friend?
attributes.name: Quartz

attributes.content: I'm just like you, one lone person.
attributes.name: Quartz

attributes.content: What am I scared of? I'll put it all on the line!
attributes.name: Quartz

attributes.text: Do what you want to do. Never again regret what's gone by. Never again fear what's yet to pass... I may not know where my next destination is—
But I know where I should be going.
